and now quackers helps a lot with the

like scanning the class path for

things like that focus does all those

essentially by code gets recorded which
describes this information
and it gets baked into the application
so this makes it starter faster to start

but really if you want to uh go

then you would look at native binaries

laptop
this uh search would give me a time to
first response
so the time between startup and first

that's definitely very very acceptable
in the land environment it uh depends a
bit on how much uh
resources you have assigned you would
look maybe at 200 or 300 milliseconds
but still it's acceptable and it gives
you like an instantaneous
feel so the user doesn't have to feel
and they need to wait
for the cold start there now there's a
challenge with native binaries
and and gravim and this is you cannot
just use all the
tools and tricks you did in your java
application in a native binary there are
things like
reflection method handles um calling

interface you cannot really

um well graviem does lots of
optimizations and it does
um things like that code elimination so
it analyzes your application
and then if you don't use a specific
method or constructor
well this would not be part of the

used so that's why
reflection just can't be used out of the
box instead you need to announce you
need to configure which are the types
you are going to reflect on
so this is why if you take such a

cannot take it and it would run
out of the box uh in a native binary in
all likelihood you need to do

the idea is um
for a very large range of popular

quakers enables their usage in graviam

prometheus and so on
there are already there are caucus

where i just use plain method calls to

there is
this is a private project for me it's a
side effort i don't have an operations
team which would be running and
monitoring this for me 24 7
which means um i really want to be sure
there isn't so
such thing like a denial of volatile
attack so this means somebody just
comes to the search invokes it again and
again and again and as it is serverless
which means i pay per use
potentially i would be in for a bad
surprise and i would have to pay
for many many requests which i doesn't
which i don't really want of course
now the question is how can i avoid this
and there's a few measures you can do
to make this really safe and the first
thing to do is put an api
usage plan in place so you can see it
here a bit on the screenshot
you can do things like say saying uh i
would like to just have 50k requests per
month and
if it goes beyond that uh you know no
more requests are accepted and that way
no more requests will be
built but there's a problem with that
and this is what's called the course
preflight request so if you have such a
sort of an
ajax based integration um into a website
as i have it
this means the browser will send this
preflight request and there you cannot
have any custom headers
and this means i cannot pass the api key
which in turn means i cannot use this
api usage plan so those
course preflight requests they still
are kind of unlimited i cannot really
limit them
and this is why i put in place what i
would call a budget circuit breaker so i
found a very nice blog post about it
essentially the idea there is to just
have another lambda
and this one um essentially
reacts to a budget alert so i have a
budget alert set up which
triggers if i reach a specific amount of
spending on aws
and if this alert triggers then this
lambda gets invoked
and what it does is it spins down the
rate limit and the burst limit of the
api so this means zero requests per
second are allowed
once this actually has kicked in which
means i wouldn't be
charged for any more requests coming in
now there's just one more problem with
that and this is this always
asynchronous so this could mean
it could take a few hours even until
this circuit breaker
really kicks in and still during the
time somebody could still
be invoking those um course preflight
requests um lots of times
and that's why i put throttling in place
so just to rate
limit the number of requests so in my
case this is a private
page you know i don't need more than
maybe a 100
or maybe just 50 concurrent requests
this would be plenty
so i can just further limit down the
speed of how quickly this would pull up
but really to be ultimately safe in the
end i put all of this behind cloudflare
service workers
and there they have a very um a very um
good free tier essentially which allows
me to handle all the course requests
over there
and then if it goes beyond their free
limit it will just be cut off and in my
case i'm just fine with that i this is
not business critical for me
so i'm just fine to shut it down after i
think 100k requests per day
and then it would cost me not nothing at
